attributes.action: either reduce or eliminate the Law Society articling and Bar Council pupillage requirements for minority candidates possessing significant English common law experience to ensure better representativeness within the legal profession
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Too frequently, qualifying as either a barrister or a solicitor depends upon the employment practices of individuals whose impartiality is not always clear. In a society that, as a matter of fact and not of philosophy, is diverse and multi-ethnic, the various abuses of non-traditional law candidates and their comparative under-representation in the British legal profession as against the numbers they comprise at the undergraduate level is wholly unacceptable. Disproportionate losses are too frequently incurred by former paralegals and law enforcers hoping to switch careers.
